Interface¶

anchorman.add(text, links, **kwargs)¶

Call class on module level, initialize and return the class.

Operate on this object instead of the class directly for simplicity. If text and links are provided apply them. The returned object contains result then already.

Examples

Use it like this:

import anchorman
a = anchorman.add(text, links)
Parameters:
  • text – The first parameter.
  • links – The second parameter.
Returns:

anchorman – the class object with added markup.
Return type:

class
class anchorman.Anchorman(*args, **kwargs)¶

Main module interface object for add and remove annotations.

Parameters:
  • text (string, optional) – The first parameter.
  • links (list, optional) – The second parameter. Second line of description should be indented.
Keyword Arguments:
 
  • selector (string)
  • replaces_per_item (int) – Default 1
  • replaces_at_all (int) – Default 5555555
  • longest_match_first (bool) – Default True

Markup_format in kwargs will update selector when processed.

add(*args, **kwargs)¶

Add links to text.

Text and links can be initialized on class level, but also reset in here as args.

Parameters:
  • text – The first parameter.
  • links – The second parameter.
Returns:

result – the enriched text.
Return type:

String
positions()¶

Get positions of all links in text.

Returns:result – list of tuples (key, positions) in text.
Return type:List
remove(*args, **kwargs)¶

Remove links/markup from text based on markup_format.

Returns:result – the cleared text.
Return type:String

Linkit¶

anchorman.linkit.add_links(text, links, replaces_per_item=None, replaces_at_all=None, markup_format=None)[source]¶

Takes html and a dictionary of words to highlight and links. Surrounds the matched words with a specified html element - by default a link.

anchorman.linkit.remove_links(content, markup_format, selector='.//a[@class="anchorman"]')[source]¶

Takes a string of HTML or text and removes all the tags - specified by selector - and leaves their content.

anchorman.linkit.replace_token(content, key, value, key_attributes, replacement_fn, replaces_per_item, link_format, count=0)[source]¶

Takes content as a string, a match to replace and the replacement.

Updates content with all matches of the “key” variable and surrounds them with an “a” tag with a class “in-text-link” and a href of the “value” variable. The key string is not case sensitive and it will only surround matches of the key string that are not surround by other letters, it tries to match whole words.

Ruturns a tuple with the updated content and the number of replacements made.

Anchorman

turns your text into hypertext.
